Emerging growth company&#160;&#160; &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&#160;13(a) of the Exchange Act.&#160;&#160; &#9744; &#160; &#160; ITEM&#160;2.02 Results of Operations and Financial Condition. On May 2, 2020, Berkshire Hathaway Inc. issued a press release announcing the Company&#8217;s earnings for the first quarter ended March 31, 2020. A copy of this press release is furnished with this report as an exhibit to this Form 8-K. ITEM&#160;5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders On May&#160;2, 2020, Berkshire Hathaway Inc. held an annual meeting of its shareholders. The agenda items for the meeting along with the vote of the Company&#8217;s Class&#160;A and Class&#160;B common shareholders voting together as a single class with respect to each of the agenda items are shown below. There were four items acted on at that meeting as follows:&#160;1)&#160;Election of Directors; 2)&#160;A non-binding &#32;resolution to approve the compensation of Berkshire&#8217;s Named Executive Officers; 3)&#160;A non-binding resolution to determine the frequency with which shareholders shall be entitled to have an advisory vote on executive compensation;&#160;and 4) A shareholder proposal requesting the adoption of a policy for improving Board and top management diversity. Following are the votes cast for and against each director. Proposal 1 &#8211; Election of Directors &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; For &#160; &#160; Against &#160; Warren E. Buffett &#160; &#160; 555,429 &#160; &#160; &#160; 8,320 &#160; Charles T. Munger &#160; &#160; 552,135 &#160; &#160; &#160; 11,614 &#160; Gregory E. Abel &#160; &#160; 553,850 &#160; &#160; &#160; 9,899 &#160; Howard G. Buffett &#160; &#160; 553,257 &#160; &#160; &#160; 10,492 &#160; Stephen B. Burke &#160; &#160; 560,980 &#160; &#160; &#160; 2,773 &#160; Kenneth I. Chenault &#160; &#160; 563,054 &#160; &#160; &#160; 695 &#160; Susan L. Decker &#160; &#160; 554,899 &#160; &#160; &#160; 8,850 &#160; David S. Gottesman &#160; &#160; 556,456 &#160; &#160; &#160; 7,294 &#160; Charlotte Guyman &#160; &#160; 551,879 &#160; &#160; &#160; 11,870 &#160; Ajit Jain &#160; &#160; 553,852 &#160; &#160; &#160; 9,897 &#160; Thomas S. Witmer &#160; &#160; 557,757 &#160; &#160; &#160; 5,992 &#160; The results of the other matters acted upon at the meeting were as follows. &#160; For &#160; &#160; Against &#160; &#160; Abstain &#160; &#160; &#160; Proposal&#160;2&#160;&#8211;&#160;Advisory vote on executive compensation &#160; &#160; 519,528 &#160; &#160; &#160; 38,726 &#160; &#160; &#160; 5,495 &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; 1 year &#160; &#160; 2&#160;years &#160; &#160; 3 years &#160; &#160; Abstain &#160; Proposal&#160;3&#160;&#8211;&#160;Advisory vote on the frequency of an advisory vote on executive compensation &#160; &#160; 138,146 &#160; &#160; &#160; 2,299 &#160; &#160; &#160; 421,424 &#160; &#160; &#160; 1,881 &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; For &#160; &#160; Against &#160; &#160; Abstain &#160; &#160; &#160; Proposal&#160;4&#160;&#8211;&#160;Shareholder&#160;proposal &#160; &#160; 69,076 &#160; &#160; &#160; 490,884 &#160; &#160; &#160; 3,789 &#160; ITEM&#160;9.01 Financial Statements and Exhibits &#160; Exhibit&#160;99.1 &#160; &#160; Berkshire Hathaway Inc.
